# CFBagCopyDescriptionCallBack

**Type Alias**

Prototype of a callback function used to get a description of a value in a bag.

## Declaration

```swift
typealias CFBagCopyDescriptionCallBack = (UnsafeRawPointer?) -> Unmanaged<CFString>?
```

## Parameters

- **value**: The value to be described.

## Return Value

A textual description of `value`. Ownership follows the [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/CoreFoundation/Conceptual/CFMemoryMgmt/Concepts/Ownership.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/20001148-103029].

## Discussion

This callback is passed to [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFBagCreate(_:_:_:_:)] in a [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFBagCallBacks] structure. This callback is used by the [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFCopyDescription(_:)] function.

## Callbacks

- **CFBagApplierFunction**: Prototype of a callback function that may be applied to every value in a bag.
- **CFBagEqualCallBack**: Prototype of a callback function used to determine if two values in a bag are equal.
- **CFBagHashCallBack**: Prototype of a callback function invoked to compute a hash code for a value. Hash codes are used when values are accessed, added, or removed from a collection.
- **CFBagReleaseCallBack**: Prototype of a callback function used to release a value before it’s removed from a bag.
- **CFBagRetainCallBack**: Prototype of a callback function used to retain a value being added to a bag.
